channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Doubts mount over Britain’s ambitious growth plans — with warnings of further tax rises possible
item.description: Doubts are mounting over the Labour government's flagship growth and investment agenda, with one analyst warning further tax rises could be on the horizon.

item.title: German powerhouse Thyssenkrupp books $1 billion impairment on struggling steel unit
item.description: Thyssenkrupp on Tuesday reported a 1-billion-euro ($1 billion) impairment on its struggling steel division.

item.title: Market veteran Howard Marks cautions that China's economic growth target is a 'Herculean challenge'
item.description: Veteran investor Howard Marks is hopeful about China's economy, but cautions that the country's growth target is a monumental challenge.

item.title: Fintech unicorns are watching Klarna's debut for signs of when IPO window will reopen
item.description: Financial technology unicorns aren't in a rush to go public even after buy now, pay later firm Klarna filed for a U.S. IPO.

item.title: China's vice premier vows to boost Hong Kong competitiveness, says stimulus push has 'benefited' the city
item.description: Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng and several top financial policymakers have gathered at the third Global Financial Leaders Investment Summit.

item.title: Thailand legalizing same-sex marriage is likely to bring a flood of tourists
item.description: Thailand's same-sex marriage law could add 4 million tourists and $2 billion in tourism revenue per year, according to a report commissioned by Agoda.

item.title: TikTok's 'Winter Arc’ challenge helps you get ahead of your New Year goals. Here’s why it’s gone viral and 4 tips to get started
item.description: The latest obsession on TikTok is the "Winter Arc" challenge, which sees young people get ahead of their New Year's Resolutions.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Tesla helps the Nasdaq snap its losing streak
item.description: Tesla helped the S&P achieve its first winning day in three and the Nasdaq break its four-day losing streak, despite Nvidia dropping 1.3%.

item.title: China is doubling down on Latin America ties to bolster influence and trade, experts say
item.description: China President Xi Jinping last week inaugurated a $3.5 billion megaport, majority-owned by China state shipping company Cosco, during a trip to Peru.

item.title: Women prefer to play mobile games. China's Tencent sees an opportunity
item.description: Tencent is betting on a rise in female players worldwide for its mobile game Honor of Kings, which rolled out to the U.S. and other countries in June.

item.title: Super Micro hires new auditor to maintain Nasdaq listing; shares pop 37%
item.description: Super Micro said on Monday that it hired BDO as its independent auditor.

item.title: Tencent challenges Amazon and Microsoft's cloud dominance by tapping into its WeChat ecosystem
item.description: Tencent Cloud is increasingly leveraging the WeChat ecosystem to set itself apart from competitors, CEO Dowson Tong said.

item.title: Jim Cramer says 'nothing truly dulls the case' for owning Tesla stock
item.description: CNBC's Jim Cramer made the case for owning stock of Tesla.

item.title: Tesla stock pops after report Trump wants to relax U.S. self-driving rules
item.description: Elon Musk was a central figure in the business world pushing for Trump's return to the White House in the lead-up to this month's elections.

item.title: Tuesday's big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: Earnings reports from Walmart and Lowe's will give investors a glimpse at consumer spending on Tuesday morning, while SpaceX readies for another launch.

item.title: Russia warns U.S. is adding fuel to fire with long-range missile decision
item.description: The U.S. decision marks a major reversal in Washington policy a mere two months before the mandate expiry of President Joe Biden.

item.title: Trump Media in reported talks to buy crypto trading platform Bakkt, sending shares soaring
item.description: Trump Media is reportedly in "advanced talks" to buy the cryptocurrency trading firm Bakkt, the Financial Times reported.

item.title: European tech CEOs urge 'Europe-first' mentality to counter U.S. dominance after Trump victory
item.description: Tech CEOs in Europe are urging the region to take bolder actions to tackle Big Tech's dominance and counter reliance on the U.S. after Donald Trump's presidential election win.

item.title: Budget travel icon Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy protection after mounting losses
item.description: The airline hasn't posted an annual profit since 2019 and lost more than $335 million in the first half of the year.

item.title: Cloud software company ServiceTitan files to go public on Nasdaq
item.description: ServiceTitan focuses on selling a variety of software to small companies, rather than enterprises.

item.title: NBA, Warner Bros. Discovery agree to settle lawsuit over live game rights
item.description: The NBA and WBD have agreed to end all legal disputes, allowing the league to move forward with new media partners Comcast, Disney and Amazon.

item.title: Samsung shares climb more than 7% after surprise $7 billion buyback plan
item.description: The company last bought back shares in November 2017.

item.title: K-pop agencies mostly struggled in third quarter — but 2025 may bring financial recovery
item.description: All of the "Big Four" companies, except JYP Entertainment, posted falls in profits for the third quarter of 2024.

item.title: Netflix said a record 60 million households worldwide tuned in for Jake Paul versus Mike Tyson fight
item.description: The highly anticipated boxing match between Jake Paul and Mike Tyson has already secured its place in the record books.

item.title: Space stocks saw big gains this week in part due to 'Trump-Elon trade' rally, analysts say
item.description: Several pure-play space stocks rallied 20% or more this week, in part driven by what sector analysts say is a "Trump-Elon trade."

item.title: Three Mile Island restart could mark a turning point for nuclear energy as Big Tech influence on power industry grows
item.description: The fortunes of the nuclear industry have shifted dramatically this year as tech companies seek carbon-free power to meet the electricity consumption of AI.

item.title: How to protect your portfolio against risks tied to President-elect Trump's tariff agenda
item.description: Astoria Portfolio Advisors CEO John Davi said he thinks the new administration's policies could be "very inflationary."

item.title: U.S. companies could be caught in the crosshairs if China retaliates to fight Trump
item.description: China's retaliation tactics could range from economic changes to matters of diplomacy and security.

item.title: Bookings for Disney's first cruise in Asia are opening soon. Here's how much the trip costs
item.description: The Disney Adventure starts at $958 for two people, but rates go higher for those who want ocean views, verandahs and "Frozen" themed suites.

item.title: I became CEO of a company that has helped millions of kids read—here's my no. 1 piece of career advice
item.description: Dr. Geetha Murali is the CEO of Room to Read, a leading nonprofit organization with the mission to create a world free from illiteracy and gender inequality.
